result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Clerked by AP. 
Defendant James E. Klotz in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  John Michael O'Boyle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
THIS COURT RECORD COVERS CASES 15CM151, 15CF466,15CF462 AND 15CF188

15CM151
Count #3:  Defendant pleads guilty.  Court finds defendant guilty.
Count #4:  Defendant pleads guilty.  Court finds defendant guilty.
IMPOSED & STAYED 
Count #390 days jail  (with huber and good time and 9 days credit)
Count #4 - 30 days jail   (with huber and good time) to run consecutive with count #3.
2 years probation (probation is concurrent)
AODA
Any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by PO
Pay court costs to include DNA surcharge, but no sample.

15CF466
Count #1:  State moves to dismiss and read-in.  Court grants motion.
Count #2:  State moves to dismiss and read-in.  Court grants motion.
(State moves to dismiss and read-in uncharged misdemeanor bail jumping, and possession of drug paraphernalia)

15CF462
Count #1:  State moves to amend to misdemeanor bail jumping 946.49(1)(a) a Class A Misdemeanor.  Court grants motion.  Defendant pleads guilty.  Court finds defendant guilty.
(State moves to dismiss and read-in uncharged retail theft - court grants)
Imposed and stayed:  60 days jail consecutive to 15CM151 with huber and good time).
2 years probation to run concurrent with other probationary periods.
AODA
47 hours Community Service
Any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by PO.
Pay court costs to include DNA surcharge.  Any cash posted to apply to costs.
Order for DNA given to the defendant in court.

15CF188
Count #1:  State moves to dismiss and read-in.  Court grants motion.
(State moves to dismiss and read-in uncharged possession of drug paraphernalia - court grants)  

Court finds it would not be adverse to public interest to grant expunction if defendant is eligible.
Order for DNA given to the defendant in court
